info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 2:39PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Otero, northeastern Huerfano, north central Las Animas and southern Pueblo Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 235 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of slow moving heavy rain producing thunderstorms in an area extending from near Colorado city to 20 miles east of Walsenburg. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, brief pea size hail and torrential rainfall will be possible with these storms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain could cause localized minor flooding of creeks, streams, roads and low water crossings. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Otero, northeastern Huerfano, north central Las Animas and southern Pueblo Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
